Status Update: "Target Completion Date"
Status Date: May 2, 2024 3:15:00 PM 
Reason:

Spoke with James yesterday regarding the complaint that was raised by the insured. I explained where we are at as well as gave him our general timeline. I met at the house today and after speaking with the insured, he explained that this situation was a big misunderstanding. Duane and Lori were not complaining about lack of communication between myself and them, for I have been in consistent contact with Duane almost everyday regarding updates and targets/scheduling. He was referring to lack of response from his insurance carrier/agent. Duane apologized for the mixup and and trouble he may have caused and I assured him that everything is good on my end. 

The wood floors in the parlor room were completed today to Duane extreme satisfaction. The bathroom crew worked today on repairing drywall imperfections and repairing paneling. The crew will be back tomorrow to sand and paint these drywall areas. 
A plumber will be coming by as well to remove the toilet and flange so the subfloor can be corrected under the toilet. The floor repair will take place next week and all bathroom repairs should be completed by the 18th. 

During our walkthrough today, Duane noticed a different area in the parlor room where the drywall tapeline is visible and we discussed how to handle this. Unfortunately this was not noticed by anyone prior to the wood floors being finished. Duane would like to wait until next moth to repair this drywall so the floor stain and varnish has time to cure before we apply drop cloths to the floor for mud and paint. The flooring finisher advised to wait about  a week although the insured requested to schedule this out later than that to make him more comfortable. I agreed and we will update when Duane and I agree to a date to repair those drywall areas.

Brendan Burns
Del Mar Builders 
Estimator 
219-257-2477

Status Update: "Job Started"

Good morning, 

I spoke with the insured on Monday and yesterday. We have been in regular communication since this project started. I have a scheduled meeting with Duane at the house on Friday morning this week to discuss areas of concern and how to move forward. We are doing our best to provide laborers that can complete work to the insureds liking, although this project is far out from our usual territory and options are limited as to what contractors of ours will travel this far. 
This was a discussion that was had with CC rep Arthur Hargrove Nov 1st - Nov 20th as you can see in notes 31-35, we were very upfront about lack of plumbers and carpenters/wood floor finishers we had that will operate in this area. Despite trying to cancel this assignment, Arthur told us we have to continue with completing the job because we wrote the estimate. We explained our concerns with taking this project on without the proper man power but our concerns were not heard by any parties. 

I have a crew meeting with me on Friday to talk with the insured and complete areas of touch up paint, and notate other areas of punchlist that need taken care of. I will update with running punchlist tomorrow. 

Brendan Burns

Good afternoon, 

PM Brendan Burns did receive a voicemail and reached back out leaving a voicemail this morning. He spoke with the adjuster yesterday regarding the issues with the basement. 

There is a small punchlist, although the insured had another, separate loss resulting in various damages to our completed work. He spoke with the adjuster regarding how to resolve this issue, and he stated the insured would have to either pay for things out of pocket or file another claim since this is a separate cause of loss. 
The issue is that their ejector pump failed during heavy rains, damaging drywall, two recently replaced door jambs/slabs and is now beginning to mold. This was not due to the result of Del Mar or the work completed. 

The punch list includes a cracked ceiling tile, (this was admittedly cracked by the insured who needed to get into the ceiling to access water shut off) although Brendan agreed to replace this for them, a thermostat that needs to be mounted, and there is a wire on the water meter that was allegedly cut during the work process. Brendan expressed to the owner that if he had the water company come out to repair, he would reimburse the invoice. 

In the voicemail left for Brendan, there was mention of another cut wire for the phone lines/internet. This line was removed during the demo/install of drywall/wall panels and has since been reinstalled, although to our knowledge the line was not damaged or cut in any way. 

The punchlist is minimal, although we would like to see how the owner would like to proceed with the resulting damages caused by the failed ejector pump, as to get these repairs done by one crew consecutively. 

If you have any further questions or concerns, please feel free to reach out to Brendan at 219-257-2477. 

Thank you.

Good morning, 


There must have been an error on sending this the first time. My apologies. 


This estimate has been re-uploaded and revised accordingly:

1. Program instructions state that contractor should collect age and condition of materials estimated and document in XactAnalysis Notes. Please revise accordingly.  DO NOT apply depreciation only document in XactAnalysis Notes

Based on my inspection the installed materials are most likely 15+ years and the condition is comparative to the age. 

2. Program instructions state, adjuster should be contacted for estimates that will exceed $15,000 and a summary of the discussion including any agreements must be uploaded in Xactanalysis.  Please provide required information

I spoke with Jared, the SF adjuster assigned to this claim, at 10:50am CT to discuss the value and nature of this loss. 

3. Program instructions state the stair sketches must be placed in their correct location on the sketch, not outside of the floor plan sketch. Please revise accordingly

REVISED 

4. Please revise the height of the fireplace to properly deduct

The fireplace is paneled and therefore not deducted in the sketch - The block placed in the sketch reflects the brick base of the fireplace and all required deductions have been made. 

5. Photos and/or documentation appear to support that footprint of lower cabinetry, tub, showers, etc. have not been deducted from flooring quantities. Please revise accordingly.
6. Photos and/or documentation appear to support that the area of cabinetry/backsplash, tub/shower surrounds, etc. have not been deducted from wall painting/cleaning quantities. Please revise accordingly.

Flooring continues under the vanity and bar areas and is documented in photos 

6. Photos and/or documentation appear to support that the area of cabinetry/backsplash, tub/shower surrounds, etc. have not been deducted from wall painting/cleaning quantities. Please revise accordingly.

-Deleted starter.

-Estimate is in line with assignment scope: Main roof 
-Removing and replacing Laminate shingles on the front lower slope of the Main roof due to damage from wind/fallen tree loss.
-Replacing 15#felt and IWS due to roofing replacement.
-Replacing drip edge, roof vent (2) on the rear slower slope per photos, step flashing, l flashing, chimney flashing, and ridge cap shingles due to damage from wind loss.  The images support these activities.
-Scaffolding set up and take down with scaffolding per day used for chimney repairs.
-Removing and replacing chimney cap.
-Removing and resetting 2 flue caps.
-Repoint masonry used for chimney repairs.

1. Program instructions state that final cleaning charges are not appropriate unless there are extenuating circumstances to support the charge(s). Please remove final cleaning charges or clarify the extenuating circumstances
REMOVED

2. Coat Closet, Half Bath - Program instructions state that if flooring is only damaged in one room, settlement is generally based on that room only unless there is a continuous run throughout other rooms. If a closing door, change in direction, or transition strip separates the room or the run is not continuous into the next room, replacement of undamaged areas should not be included. The service provider should not delay the review process because of matching concerns instead estimate to repair/replace the damaged material only. Please revise flooring replacement as outlined in the program instructions.

When refinishing oak floors that continue through doorways where no transition strip is present, color variations and flashing of polyurethane is often visible. To restore the flooring to it's original state, refinishing the areas that continue into the closet and bathroom would be required. 

, 3. Program instructions require photos of a straight edge placed on wood flooring to show cupping and to confirm the extent of damages to flooring

A notated photo is included in the estimate

4. Line 14 PNT P+, Line 15 PNT MASKLFT - Please deduct the coat closet
5. Program instructions state that removing/installing switches and outlet cover plates, dropping light fixtures including ceiling lights, ceiling fans, recessed lights, and moving items from walls is already included within painting as standard prep work. Please revise accordingly.

REVISED
6. Line 22 DRY ½ - Per photos please revise to replace only    REVISED

7. Line 36 CAB VANRS, Line 37 MBL VTSNKRS – Photos do not support the flooring runs under the vanity.  Please revise accordingly

A noted photo is included - It is not common practice to install oak flooring around bathroom vanities due to the thickness of wood 

8. Program instructions require that laminate flooring be estimated at standard grade unless discussed with the adjuster and substantiated. Please update XactAnalysis notes with the full name of the adjuster who provided approval as well as the date and time of approval, or revise laminate flooring to standard grade.

REVISED - An ITEL sample will be tested once coverage is confirmed 

9. Family Room – Will the painted shoe around the perimeter of the room need to be addressed?  If so, please add
REVISED 

10. Photos appear to show minimal damage to cabinets. It appears it would be possible to repair cabinets instead of replacing them. Please revise to repair or clarify why repairs would not be possible.

Costs, time, and labor of finding materials and rebuilding cabinets often exceed the costs of replacement and results vary. 

11. Line 46 CAB VANCS – Please revise to CAB VAN and add MBL VTSNKRS to detach/reset the top
REVISED 

12. Line 49 PLM PTRAPRS – Please remove the overlapping/duplicate charge REVISED


Thank you, 


Dean P. Gulotta 
Del Mar Builders
708-257-8216

Good evening, 
 
 The insured is aware that the 2 additional coats of paint are not approved by the insurance policy, this is OOP change order the insured added before job start. The insured is expecting for a paint job to including extensive prep work to old and worn paneling and expects the paneling to look new when we are done. We tried to manage expectation regarding the paneling painting, an tat there is no way to prep and repair paneling that has these kinds of impurities and made to look new side from replacing the paneling. 
 
 When talks between the insured and the PM Jason Brendl were underway regarding scheduling the kitchen floor refinishing, the insured mentioned a range of dates that shew was already going to be out of town and asked if we could schedule the floor refinish during this time. We did not request that she need to be out of the house during these repairs. the flooring repairs do not inhibit the customers from entering their home our allowing them access to the second floor of the home where the office and bedrooms, as well as a bathroom are located. The floors started Tuesday the 2nd, during the time the insured was out of town, and the floors were completed Friday late morning, and the insured came back into town Friday evening. The only request that was made was that the insured stay off the floors Friday night an wait until Saturday to walk into the kitchen. Sunday afternoon, the insured texted Jason relaying that she was not satisfied with the floor refinish work, and that she would like for someone to come by and have a look. Jason let the insured know that he would be stopping by Monday afternoon to check on the crew and take a look at the floors. When Jason arrived, the crew was working and the insured entered the home, and said that she cannot talk and needed to make a phone call, and would not be available to have a conversation with Jason until 430PM. Understandably, Jason was not in a position to wait 3 hours for the insured to be available, although the crew had already been working on touching up the areas that the insured did not like. 
 
 On Tuesday the 9th, The insured was using the basement for her office space working, and our foreman asked when she would be finished with work so the drywall crew can get down there and start on drywall repairs. The insured asked how long the crew would need, because it will be difficult to move her space that night because "every other room in the house is not usable". this seemed unreasonable because there are three bedrooms, a living room, and an office in the basement that is usable, where no work is being completed. the insured then asked if they can start around 2. Our foreman asked if they could start down there at around 330PM instead, and that the crew would need a few hours to finish drywall and tape, so that it could dry overnight and be ready for additional coats of mud (if needed) or ready to sand by Wednesday morning. The insured responded saying "okay, thanks then you can start drywall at 5PM tonight." 
 
 If needed, we have documented text correspondence between our foreman Tammy and the insured, as well as separate texts with our PM Jason regarding this situation that we can provide. We are doing our best the work with the insured, we understand that any construction taking place in a residence can be inconvenient and stressful.. however our crews need to be able to access these areas, and be allowed to complete work tasks without constant micromanagement and complaints. Any workmanships issues will be addressed, although some of the complaints are about work that has not been completed or considered the "finished product." 
 
 At this time, Jason has elected to remove the current crew and replace with new faces to hopefully salvage the situation.
 
 Brendan Burns
 Del Mar Builders 
 Estimator 
 219-257-2477<

Revised estimate has been uploaded. See notes below:
 
 1. Sketch - Please revise accordingly.***LF for trim allowances - REVISED
 
 2. Line 1 DMO DTRUCK ¿ Per MICA, a DMO DUMP< is recommended - REVISED
 
 3. Line 6. CON BIDITM ¿ Please remove open pending allowance and request a packout assignment after review.
 
 4. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF - Program instructions state, quantities for flooring must be broken down into removal and replacement. Waste is built into the Xactimate unit cost for all flooring line items except carpet and sheet vinyl. Please revise accordingly. - REVISED
 
 5. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF- 
 -Does the member have material from the initial installation that would allow repair of the floor for a reasonable uniform appearance?--If yes, reimburse member for the material provided. - NO...FLOORS ARE ORIGINAL TO THE BUILDING (APPROX. 2007) AND WERE THERE WHEN THE INSURED MOVED IN APPROX 2 YEARS AGO
 How is the flooring installed (glued down, floating, etc.)? - NOT SURE AT THIS TIME...INSURED DID NOT WANT A SAMPLE REMOVED AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION
 -Did member have an existing threshold at the doorway separating the run of flooring? ONLY INTO OTHER UNAFFECTED ROOMS THAT ARE NOT REPRESENTED IN THIS ESTIMATE (BATHROOMS AND A BEDROOM THAT HAS CARPET)
 -Are there natural break points? - NO...FLOORING IS CONTIUOUS THROUGHOUT ALL AREAS IN THE ESTIMATE
 -When sanding and finishing has been completed, does reasonable uniform appearance exists? - NOT LIKELY...PREFINISHED AND/OR ENGINEERED WOOD FLOORING HAVE MIXED RESULTS AT BEST WHEN SANDED.ONCE THE TOP VENEER IS SANDED DOWN, THE WOOD UNDERNEATH HAS A VERY DULL LOOK. THIS APPROACH IS DEFINIETLY NOT RECCOMMENED IN A HOME OF THIS QUALITY
 -Is the wood floor product prefinished with factory finished and micro bevel? - YES
 
 6. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF - Removal and replacement of cupped wood flooring has been included in this estimate. Please clarify why the wood flooring must be removed at this time instead of waiting to see if the cupping goes away. - THAT WOULD BE A CONVERSATION THE INSURANCE WOULD NEED TO HAVE WITH THEIR INSURED IF THAT IS THE DIRECTION THEY WANT TO TAKE. I"M REASONABLE SURE THE INSURED IS LOOKING TO GET THESE REPAIRS ADDRESSED ASAP AND NOT LOOKING TO WAIT
 
 7. Estimate Wide FCT UC1/4- When estimating repairs, do not include replacement of materials which cannot be verified to exist and have loss related damages - CORK UNDERLAYMENT HAS BEEN REMOVED FOR NOW
 
 8. Line 39. PLM SNKDRS - Xactimate line item definitions state the detach and reset unit price for a solid surface countertop has already factored in the necessary labor cost to complete this task while leaving the sink in place throughout this process. Confirmation is needed that the estimate does not include any unnecessary sink D&R charges or if such charges are necessary that this has been clarified and supported appropriately. - REVISED TO D&R OF P-TRAP AND SUPPLY LINES
 
 9. Line 28. CAB LOW - When evaluating the scope of work, the feasibility of performing repairs rather than replacement should always be considered. If possible and appropriate, repairs to damaged items should be estimated. Please clarify why repairs are not appropriate or revise accordingly. - THIS IS A REPAIR...REPLACING THE WATER DAMAGED BOX AND REPURPOSING THE EXISTING DOORS TO ENSURE CONTINUITY
 
 Edward Jones
 Estimator
 Del Mar Builders

 Estimate_Review_Comments
 
 Please see the comments below and address each item. For items that will not be revised, please provide individual clarification listed out in an XactAnalysis note. If there are extenuating circumstances preventing the revisions from being addressed, please provide explanation and date in which the requested revisions will be made:
 
 1. Sketch - Photos and/or documentation appear to support that line items written at PF dimensions have not been deducted by LF of doors, showers/tubs, vanities, cabinets, built-ins/bookcases, etc. Please revise accordingly.***LF for trim allowances
 
 2. Line 1 DMO DTRUCK ¿ Per MICA, a DMO DUMP< is recommended
 
 3. Line 6. CON BIDITM ¿ Please remove open pending allowance and request a packout assignment after review. 
 
 4. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF - Program instructions state, quantities for flooring must be broken down into removal and replacement. Waste is built into the Xactimate unit cost for all flooring line items except carpet and sheet vinyl. Please revise accordingly.
 
 5. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF- Program instructions state, when evaluating flooring replacement/repairs, the following should be considered. Detailed information is required in order to evaluate whether the flooring can be repaired. Please provide the details in an XactAnalysis note:
 -Does the member have material from the initial installation that would allow repair of the floor for a reasonable uniform appearance?--If yes, reimburse member for the material provided.
 How is the flooring installed (glued down, floating, etc.)?
 -Did member have an existing threshold at the doorway separating the run of flooring?
 -Are there natural break points?
 -When sanding and finishing has been completed, does reasonable uniform appearance exists?
 -Is the wood floor product prefinished with factory finished and micro bevel?
 
 6. Estimate Wide FCW AVPF - Removal and replacement of cupped wood flooring has been included in this estimate. Please clarify why the wood flooring must be removed at this time instead of waiting to see if the cupping goes away.
 
 7. Estimate Wide FCT UC1/4- When estimating repairs, do not include replacement of materials which cannot be verified to exist and have loss related damages (i.e. underlayment, sleeper systems, shower system construction, etc.). Notes should be provided in XactAnalysis referencing the possible need to replace these items; however the items should not be included in the estimate. Please revise accordingly.**Please remove and can be supplemented once tear out begins/photos available. 
 
 8. Line 39. PLM SNKDRS - Xactimate line item definitions state the detach and reset unit price for a solid surface countertop has already factored in the necessary labor cost to complete this task while leaving the sink in place throughout this process. Confirmation is needed that the estimate does not include any unnecessary sink D&R charges or if such charges are necessary that this has been clarified and supported appropriately.
 
 9. Line 28. CAB LOW - When evaluating the scope of work, the feasibility of performing repairs rather than replacement should always be considered. If possible and appropriate, repairs to damaged items should be estimated. Please clarify why repairs are not appropriate or revise accordingly. 
 
 
 Thank you, 
 
 
 [Reviewer note ¿ packout requested, GEN LAB for high rise/dense urban location, age of flooring 2005]

 JOB UPDATE: The form for the concrete porch will be completed today and we are planning on installing the new concrete porch either this Saturday or Monday. However, due to inclement weather this week, the job has fallen a bit behind schedule.
 
 In addition, we have encountered a complication with the insured's cracked sewer line, which has caused sewage to back up in his basement. As a precaution, we have camera'd the lines yesterday to determine the cause and have taken measures to mitigate the sewage from further damage. We are currently working with the insured to determine the cost of the repairs so that the issue does not persist.
 
 Please note that this is a pre-existing damage and is not related to the fire in any way. We are doing our best to resolve the issue in a timely and efficient manner.
 
 Once the concrete porch is completed, team will finish the rest of the facia soffit and everything will be completed. However, I would like to remind you that these additional costs will not be covered as the insured has exceeded his coverage limits.
 
 I will post photos of the completed porch and the broken sewer line for your records shortly.
 
 Thank you!
 
 Angela P. Bermudez

Good afternoon,

 Firstly, I am pleased to inform you that the Facia/Soffit work will be completed by the end of this week.

However, I would like to bring to your attention that the concrete front stairs have unfortunately crumbled due to age and wear and tear. We had initially planned to frame a wooden deck, but upon further inspection, we have found that the damages are too severe. Therefore, in the interest of safety, we have decided to install a new concrete porch at no additional cost to the insured. Please note that this was not a part of the initial loss, but we believe it is necessary to ensure the safety of the property.

Lastly, I would like to inform you that the home is currently in a state of disarray. We have found feces throughout the house and the basement has also experienced a sewer backup. We are currently assisting Mr. Sanders with this issue and have started the process of cameraing the existing line to identify the problem.

I will provide an additional update on Friday regarding the progress at the property. In the meantime, if you have any questions or concerns just let us know and also keep in mind that none of these costs are being covered by the insurance loss and he well exceeded his policy limits.
